abstract.p: Major League Soccer and MetroStars reach agreement with Lothar Matthaus that will keep him with team (S)

block.p: After a three-hour meeting at the league office in Midtown Manhattan late yesterday, the MetroStars and Major League Soccer reached an agreement with Lothar Matthaus that will keep the German star with the MetroStars. The agreement came after two tumultuous weeks following a back injury to the defender.

After a three-hour meeting at the league office in Midtown Manhattan late yesterday, the MetroStars and Major League Soccer reached an agreement with Lothar Matthaus that will keep the German star with the MetroStars. The agreement came after two tumultuous weeks following a back injury to the defender.

Nick Sakiewicz, general manager of the MetroStars, said Matthaus would join the team for practice Wednesday and it would be some time before he could start playing. The MetroStars play host to the Miami Fusion this afternoon and have a U.S. Cup game against Tampa Bay on Tuesday on Long Island.
